books.title: Trent’s Last Case
books.author: E. C. Bentley
books.summary: A journalist investigates the murder of a Wall Street kingpin.

books.title: The Sea-Wolf
books.author: Jack London
books.summary: Literary critic Humphrey Van Weyden is pressed into service aboard a seal-hunting schooner by its cruel, ruthless, but intelligent captain.

books.title: The Diary
books.author: Samuel Pepys
books.summary: The diary of a man living in London in the 17th century.

books.title: Eminent Victorians
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: Four witty and biting biographies of Victorians that take aim at the moral superiority of their subject’s time.

books.title: Little Lord Fauntleroy
books.author: Frances Hodgson Burnett
books.summary: A poor young boy unexpectedly inherits a peerage and travels to England to live with his grandfather, an Earl.

books.title: Something New
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: Two young writers experience romance and adventure in Lord Emsworth’s Blandings Castle.

books.title: The Eumenides
books.author: Aeschylus
books.summary: A man is pursued by wrathful goddesses for avenging his father’s murder, and finds refuge in Athens where a trial determines his fate.

books.title: Figures of Earth
books.author: James Branch Cabell
books.summary: A young swineherd rises to the rank of Count by following his own thinking and desires.

books.title: The Rasp
books.author: Philip MacDonald
books.summary: A retired colonel investigates the elaborate murder of a cabinet minister.

books.title: The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A London lawyer investigates the relationship between a brilliant scientist and a misshapen misanthrope.

books.title: The Mirror of the Sea
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: An autobiographical memoir on Joseph Conrad’s maritime experiences and his relationship with the sea.

books.title: Lady Audley’s Secret
books.author: M. E. Braddon
books.summary: When his friend disappears suddenly in mysterious circumstances, a young, idle barrister feels forced to investigate, even at the peril of destroying the happiness of his beloved uncle.

books.title: A Pluralistic Universe
books.author: William James
books.summary: A philosopher gives an introduction to radical empiricism and how it relates to the experienced world.

books.title: The Theory of Moral Sentiments
books.author: Adam Smith
books.summary: Adam Smith assesses the sources of human morality and the role of human sympathies in judging the propriety of our actions and behaviors.

books.title: Mirèio
books.author: Frédéric Mistral
books.summary: Two young Provençal lovers are kept apart by their social class.

books.title: The Indiscreet Jewels
books.author: Denis Diderot
books.summary: The Sultan of the Congo brings about philosophical inquiry and scandal when he is granted a magical ring that permits him to compel speech from the vaginas of the women of his court.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Philip K. Dick
books.summary: A collection of short works by science fiction legend Philip K. Dick.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: E. M. Forster
books.summary: A collection of E. M. Forster’s short stories, ordered by date of their original publication.

books.title: Festus
books.author: Philip James Bailey
books.summary: A man goes on a quest for knowledge, truth, and understanding in the face of the complexities of existence and spirituality.

books.title: The Cruise of the Alerte
books.author: E. F. Knight
books.summary: An English journalist sets sail in search of treasure buried on a remote desert island.
